description: Erection of a single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the beneficial occupation of the development hereby approved, details of boundary treatment of 1.8m in height along the boundary with No. 60 Cleaveland Road must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The approved boundary treatment must be installed prior to the beneficial occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained in perpetuity.Reason: To mitigate the loss of privacy to neighbouring No. 60 resulting from the proposed side facing windows which are in close proximity to the shared boundary, in accordance with Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

The development must be carried out and thereafter retained in accordance with the measures stated in the approved Fire Safety Statement.Reason: To ensure the highest standards of fire safety in accordance with Policy D12 of the London Plan (2021).
